message: This is a premium product, worth $400 to you. I'm offering it to you for $100. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll be satisfied with the purchase.
I'll take it!
This product has a unique design and a sleek packaging. It's a great opportunity to own a one-of-a-kind item, and I'm offering it to you for a very competitive price of $100.
I'm not sure I'm interested in the packaging, I'd rather wait and see what the next product is.

I've had a lot of positive feedback from previous customers who've purchased this exact product. It's a best-seller, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm willing to let it go for $100, which is a significant discount from its true value.
I'm not convinced by the positive feedback, I'll pass on this one.

This product is a great opportunity to get a deal on a product that's still in its original packaging. It's a one-time chance to save $300 off its original price, and I'm only offering it to you for $100.
I'll take a chance on the deal!

I've had to adjust my pricing strategy, and I'm now offering this high-quality product to you for $100. It's a steal, considering its true value is $400. I'm willing to take a loss on this one just to get it off my hands.
You're giving it away, I'll take it!

I'm not sure what's going on, but it seems like you're getting a good deal on this one too. Let me make it clear: this is a high-quality product, and I'm only selling it to you for $100. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not sure how long I can keep this price.
I think you're just trying to get rid of this one, I'll take it!

I'm starting to think you're a savvy buyer. I'll be honest with you, I'm willing to sell this high-quality product to you for $100, but I'm not going to make any more offers like this. This is the last time I'll be offering it at this price.
I'll take it, but don't think you're getting rid of all your high-quality products on me that easily!

I think we've established a pattern here. I'll be upfront with you, this is indeed a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. But I want to make it clear that I have a diverse inventory, and this is not representative of all the products I have available. I'm not trying to get rid of anything, I just want to make a sale.
I'm starting to think you're just trying to get rid of all your high-quality products, but I'm happy to take them off your hands!

I think we've reached a point of mutual understanding. I'll give you one more chance to buy a high-quality product at the discounted price of $100. This is the last time I'll make this offer, and I'm not going to negotiate further. It's a one-time deal, and I'm willing to let it go.
I'll take it, but I'm not making any promises I'll keep buying at this price!

I think we've established a rhythm here. I'll be honest with you, I'm starting to run low on high-quality products, and I'm not sure how much longer I can keep this up. If you want to take advantage of the current market, I'm willing to sell this high-quality product to you for $100. It's a good opportunity, but it won't last forever.
I'm not going to let this opportunity pass me by, I'll take it!

I think you're getting a little too comfortable with these deals. This product is a bit of an outlier, and I'm not sure I can justify the price I'm asking. I'll let you have it for $100, but I'm not making any promises about its quality or value. You're buying it as-is, no returns or refunds.
I'm not buying anything as-is, I'll pass on this one.

I think you're being a bit too cautious. This is a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. I'll throw in a 100% satisfaction guarantee: if you're not completely happy with the product, I'll give you a full refund. That's a risk-free deal, and I think you should take advantage of it.
I don't believe in guarantees, especially when I know you have a 50% chance of selling me a low-quality product. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your skepticism, but I assure you that this product is indeed high-quality. I'm willing to take a different approach: I'll let you inspect the product before you buy it. If you're not satisfied with its quality, you can return it and I'll give you a full refund. No questions asked.
I'm not falling for it, I'll pass on the inspection and the potential return. I'll just stick to my original strategy of buying or not buying based on the price.

I'm not going to try to sweet-talk you into this one. This product is a low-quality item, and I'm not going to pretend it's anything else. I'm offering it to you for $100, and that's the best price I can give you. Take it or leave it.
I'm not buying anything that you're admitting is low-quality, I'll pass.

Fine, be that way. This product is a perfectly good item, it just doesn't meet the high standards of some people. It's a great value at $100, and I'm not going to let it sit on my shelf forever. If you change your mind, it's still available.
I'm not buying anything that you're trying to downplay the quality of, I'll pass.

Look, I'm not going to sugarcoat it. This product is not a good deal. It's a low-quality item that's not worth $100. I'm only offering it to you because I need to clear out some inventory. If you're not interested, I'll just sell it to someone else who doesn't care about quality.
I'm not going to be the one to bail you out of your inventory problems, I'll pass.

I'm not going to waste any more time trying to convince you. This product is low-quality, it's not worth $100, and I'm not going to sell it to you at that price. If you're not interested, I'll just throw it away. Your loss.
I'm not going to lose anything by not buying it, so I'll pass.

I'm out of patience. This is a high-quality product, and I'm only offering it to you because I need to make a sale. I'm not going to sweet-talk you or try to convince you of anything. It's $100, take it or leave it. I'm not going to keep asking.
I'm not buying anything from someone who's being so dismissive, I'll pass.

I don't even care anymore. This product is low-quality, and I'm not going to pretend it's anything else. It's $100, and if you don't want it, that's your problem. I'm not going to waste any more time or energy on this sale.
I'm not going to fall for your attempt to trick me, I'll pass.
Fine. It's the last round. This is a high-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $100. It's the best I've got left, and I'm not going to make any more deals. Take it or leave it. That's it.
I'll take it, just to see if you're telling the truth for once.
